metadata.title: CVE-2022-48657 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:arm64: topology: fix possible overflow in amu_fie_setup()cpufreq_get_hw_max_freq() returns max frequency in kHz as *unsigned int*,while freq_inv_set_max_ratio() gets passed this frequency in Hz as 'u64'.Multiplying max frequency by 1000 can potentially result in overflow --multiplying by 1000ULL instead should avoid that...Found by Linux Verification Center (linuxtesting.org) with the SVACE staticanalysis tool.
